title: Luca Pianca
text:
Luca Pianca (born 1958) is a <a href="Swiss%20people">Swiss</a> musician-<a href="lutenist">lutenist</a> whose specialty is <a href="archlute">archlute</a>. In 1985 he co - founded "<a href="Il%20Giardino%20Armonico">Il Giardino Armonico</a>"., a pioneering Italian early-music ensemble based in <a href="Milan">Milan</a>. He has premiered works by the contemporary lutenist-composer <a href="Roman%20Turovsky-Savchuk">Roman Turovsky-Savchuk</a> at international festivals, and received numerous international awards for his recordings.
Early life and education.
Luca Pianca was born in <a href="Lugano">Lugano</a>, <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a> of <a href="ethnic">ethnic</a> <a href="Italians">Italian</a> ancestry. He studied with <a href="Nikolaus%20Harnoncourt">Nikolaus Harnoncourt</a> at the <a href="Mozarteum%20University%20of%20Salzburg">Mozarteum University of Salzburg</a>, <a href="Austria">Austria</a>.
Career.
Since 1982 Pianca has collaborated with "<a href="Concentus%20Musicus%20Wien">Concentus Musicus Wien</a>". He also served as a lutenist at <a href="Zurich">Zurich</a> Opera House. In 1985 he was co-founder of Il Giardino Armonico (The Harmonic Garden), an Italian early-music ensemble that pioneered performances of many <a href="Baroque">Baroque</a> and contemporary works.
Luca Pianca has recorded more than 20 CDs, both with and without "<a href="Il%20Giardino%20Armonico">Il Giardino Armonico</a>", including complete recordings of lute repertoire by <a href="J.S.Bach">J.S.Bach</a> and <a href="Antonio%20Vivaldi">Antonio Vivaldi</a>.
He has partnered with internationally known <a href="opera">opera</a> singers and soloists such as Italian <a href="Cecilia%20Bartoli">Cecilia Bartoli</a>, <a href="Eva%20Mei">Eva Mei</a>, and American <a href="Sylvia%20McNair">Sylvia McNair</a>.
Since 1999, Pianca has teamed with <a href="viola%20da%20gamba">viola da gamba</a> player <a href="Vittorio%20Ghielmi">Vittorio Ghielmi</a> to record numerous CDs. Since 2001 he has also collaborated with the contemporary lutenist-composer <a href="Roman%20Turovsky-Savchuk">Roman Turovsky-Savchuk</a>, whose works he premiered at several international festivals: <a href="Urbino">Urbino</a>, <a href="Salamanca">Salamanca</a>, <a href="Paris">Paris</a>, and <a href="Vilnius">Vilnius</a>, "inter alia".
